segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and it’s spreading all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in the middle of it, and she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the drain is clogged or if she just forgot to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and it’s going to be a mess to clean up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she’s just drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are right behind her, and they could slip on the wet floor at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don’t want to startle her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so bizarre—everything is so calm but so chaotic at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the water before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how absurd this is.
segments.speaker: PAR
